00001 function varargout = S_viewer(varargin)
00002 % S_VIEWER M-file for S_viewer.fig
00003 %      Run file from main program directory
00004 %      S_VIEWER, by itself, creates a new S_VIEWER or raises the existing
00005 %      singleton*.
00006 %
00007 %      H = S_VIEWER returns the handle to a new S_VIEWER or the handle to
00008 %      the existing singleton*.
00009 %
00010 %      S_VIEWER('CALLBACK',hObject,eventData,handles,...) calls the local
00011 %      function named CALLBACK in S_VIEWER.M with the given input arguments.
00012 %
00013 %      S_VIEWER('Property','Value',...) creates a new S_VIEWER or raises the
00014 %      existing singleton*.  Starting from the left, property value pairs are
00015 %      applied to the GUI before S_viewer_OpeningFcn gets called.  An
00016 %      unrecognized property name or invalid value makes property application
00017 %      stop.  All inputs are passed to S_viewer_OpeningFcn via varargin.
00018 %
00019 %      *See GUI Options on GUIDE's Tools menu.  Choose "GUI allows only one
00020 %      instance to run (singleton)".
00021 %
00022 % See also: GUIDE, GUIDATA, GUIHANDLES
00023

00030 gui_State = struct('gui_Name',       mfilename, ...
00031                    'gui_Singleton',  gui_Singleton, ...
00032                    'gui_OpeningFcn', @S_viewer_OpeningFcn, ...
00033                    'gui_OutputFcn',  @S_viewer_OutputFcn, ...
00034                    'gui_LayoutFcn',  [] , ...
00035                    'gui_Callback',   []);
00036 if nargin && ischar(varargin{1})
00037     gui_State.gui_Callback = str2func(varargin{1});
00038 end
00039 
00040 if nargout
00041     [varargout{1:nargout}] = gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00042 else
00043     gui_mainfcn(gui_State, varargin{:});
00044 end

00047 % =====================================================================
00048 %> @brief Executes just before S_viewer is made visible. Search for
00049 %> Electrical field objects. Set them  in list box. Plot third sensitivity
00050 %> distribution map.
00051 % =====================================================================
00052 function S_viewer_OpeningFcn(hObject, eventdata, handles, varargin)
00053 % This function has no output args, see OutputFcn.
00054 % hObject    handle to figure
00055 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00056 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00057 % varargin   command line arguments to S_viewer (see VARARGIN)
00058 
00059 % Choose default command line output for S_viewer
00060 handles.output = hObject;
00061 
00062 % Update handles structure
00063 guidata(hObject, handles);
00064 
00065 update_listbox(handles);
00066 
00067 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00068 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00069 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00070                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00071                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00072 else
00073                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00074 end 
00075 
00076      komenda=[var1,'.draw_sensitivity(','3',');'];
00077     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00078      evalin('base',komenda); 
00079 % This sets up the initial plot - only do when we are invisible
00080 % so window can get raised using S_viewer.
00081 
00082 
00083 % UIWAIT makes S_viewer wait for user response (see UIRESUME)
00084 % uiwait(handles.figure1);

00098 % =====================================================================
00099 %> @brief Executes on button press in update. 
00100 %> Set active selected Electrical_field object. Set active selected sensitivy map
00101 %> display from pop-up menu Sensitivity or Resize sensitivity 
00102 % =====================================================================
00103 function pushbutton1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00104 % hObject    handle to pushbutton1 (see GCBO)
00105 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00106 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00107 axes(handles.axessens);
00108 %cla;
00109 popup_val = get(handles.popupmenu1, 'Value');
00110 
00111 
00112 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00113 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00114 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00115                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00116                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00117 else
00118                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00119 end 
00120 
00121 %'Sensitivity'
00122 if(popup_val==1)% original sensitivity
00123      komenda=[var1,'.draw_sensitivity(1);'];
00124     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');     
00125      evalin('base',komenda);  
00126      
00127 elseif (popup_val==2) % resize sensitivity
00128      param=[var1,'.simulation_discret_matrix_size'];
00129      komenda=[var1,'.draw_resize_sensitivity(','1,',param,',',param,',','0);'];       
00130      evalin('base',komenda);  
00131 end

00162 function CloseMenuItem_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00163 % hObject    handle to CloseMenuItem (see GCBO)
00164 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00165 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00166 selection = questdlg(['Close ' get(handles.figure1,'Name') '?'],...
00167                      ['Close ' get(handles.figure1,'Name') '...'],...
00168                      'Yes','No','Yes');
00169 if strcmp(selection,'No')
00170     return;
00171 end

00201 % =====================================================================
00202 %> @brief Executes on slider movement. 
00203 %> Change and display sensitivity map for selected Electrical_filed object.
00204 % =====================================================================
00205 function slider1_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00206 % hObject    handle to slider1 (see GCBO)
00207 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00208 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00209 
00210 % Hints: get(hObject,'Value') returns position of slider
00211 %        get(hObject,'Min') and get(hObject,'Max') to determine range of slider
00212 
00213 
00214 axes(handles.axessens);
00215 %cla;
00216 
00217 popup_val = get(handles.popupmenu1, 'Value');
00218 
00219 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00220 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00221 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00222                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00223                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00224 else
00225                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00226 end 
00227 
00228 
00229 sliderValue = get(handles.slider1,'Value');
00230 val=round(sliderValue);
00231 % get from workspace
00232 sens_num_max=evalin('base',[var1,'.sens_matrix_num']);
00233 set(handles.slider1,'Max', sens_num_max);
00234 if (~isnumeric(val))
00235     val=1;
00236 end
00237 
00238 if(val<=0)
00239     val=1;
00240 elseif (val>sens_num_max)
00241     val=1;
00242 end
00243 %'Sensitivity'
00244 if(popup_val==1)
00245      komenda=[var1,'.draw_sensitivity(',num2str(val),');'];
00246     %evalin('base', 'Ef.draw_sensitivity(''all'');');    
00247      evalin('base',komenda);     
00248 elseif (popup_val==2)
00249      param=[var1,'.simulation_discret_matrix_size'];
00250      komenda=[var1,'.draw_resize_sensitivity(',num2str(val),',',param,',',param,',','0);'];
00251      %komenda=[var1,'.draw_resize_sensitivity(','1,',param,',',param,',','0);'];      
00252      evalin('base',komenda);     
00253 end

00264     set(hObject,'BackgroundColor',[.9 .9 .9]);
00265 end

00267 % =====================================================================
00268 %> @brief Search for Electrical field objects in workspace.
00269 % =====================================================================
00270 function update_listbox(handles)
00271 % http://www.mathworks.com/access/helpdesk/help/techdoc/creating_guis/f6-7673.html
00272 vars = evalin('base','who');
00273 k=1;
00274 any_elements=0;
00275 for i=1:length(vars);
00276         
00277     komenda=['isa(',vars{i},',','''Electrical_field_2D''',');'];    
00278     ret = evalin('base',komenda);    
00279     if ret==1
00280         ef_vector(k)=vars(i);
00281         k=k+1;
00282         any_elements=1;
00283     end
00284 end
00285 if any_elements==0
00286     errordlg('There is''t Electrical_field object in workspace. First run simulation.',...
00287         'Error');
00288     error('There is''t Electrical_field object in workspace. First run simulation.');
00289 end
00290 
00291 set(handles.listbox1,'String',ef_vector)
00292

00316 % =====================================================================
00317 %> @brief Executes on button sum press. Draw sum of sensitivity maps.
00318 % =====================================================================
00319 function pushbutton4_Callback(hObject, eventdata, handles)
00320 % hObject    handle to pushbutton4 (see GCBO)
00321 % eventdata  reserved - to be defined in a future version of MATLAB
00322 % handles    structure with handles and user data (see GUIDATA)
00323 
00324 popup_val = get(handles.popupmenu1, 'Value');
00325 
00326 list_entries = get(handles.listbox1,'String');
00327 index_selected = get(handles.listbox1,'Value');
00328 if length(index_selected) ~= 1
00329                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
00330                                                 'Incorrect Selection','modal')
00331 else
00332                 var1 = list_entries{index_selected(1)};         
00333 end 
00334 
00335 
00336 %'Sensitivity'
00337 if (popup_val==1)
00338  fh_sum = figure;
00339  name=[var1,' Sensitivity Map Sum'];
00340  set(fh_sum,'Name',name);
00341  komenda=[var1,'.draw_sum_S_map();'];
00342  evalin('base',komenda);
00343  
00344 elseif (popup_val==2)
00345     
00346  fh_sum = figure;
00347  name=[var1,' Resize Sensitivity Map Sum'];
00348  set(fh_sum,'Name',name);
00349  komenda=[var1,'.draw_sum_resize_S_map();'];
00350  evalin('base',komenda);   
00351   
00352 end

00393                 errordlg('You must select one element',...
